xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: The authors would like to thank the providers for their open stereo data sets and also to Dr. T. Bülow and Prof. E. Bayro-Corrochano for the wonderful explanation of their pioneer works. And thanks also to Prof. Y.C. Liu for his constructive comments and suggestions. This work was supported by Shanghai Postdoctoral Foundation (06R214138).

organization.$: Shanghai Key Lab of Digital Media Processing and Communication

head.citation-title: Quaternion wavelet phase based stereo matching for uncalibrated images
head.abstracts: This paper proposes a quaternion wavelet phase based stereo matching (QWPSM) scheme for uncalibrated image pairs. In this scheme, we estimate the disparity by directly establishing correspondences between quaternionic phase structures of two quaternion wavelet filtered (QWF) images. Firstly, linear-phase quaternion wavelet filters (LPQWFs) are constructed from real biorthogonal wavelet bases. Then, quaternion phases are extracted under each scale through quaternion wavelet filtering of the multiscale transformed image pyramids. The disparity estimation is formed as a minimization process of a local energy weighted cost function, and propagated from coarse to fine scales. Costs can adaptively alleviate the negative effects of phase singularities, which are the main causes of mismatches in phase-based stereo matching. Multiscale matching strategy is used to avoid phase wrapping and improve convergence speed. Experimental results are promising in various image pairs. © 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

organization.$: Shanghai Key Lab of Digital Media Processing and Communication

copyright.$: Copyright 2008 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.
